li.b: Step 1: Make sure the ../SplunkForPCAP/bin/ folder has all administrative privileges to execute the batch and shell script
Step 2: Make sure you have tshark installed (delivered with Wireshark)
Step 3: Make sure you have set SPLUNK_HOME variable
Click on the next slide and check how to configure the PCAP File Location!

ul.li:
Getting started - PCAP File Location! To allow Splunk to collect your PCAP Files you have to specify where you have stored your pcap files.
You can specify your location in the Data Inputs (via Settings) --> PCAP File Location.
Click on the next slide to understand what happens with your pcap files after they are indexed!

Getting started - Notes about the data! 1. Sourcetype defined for indexing that data is "pcap:csv"
2. You will recognize that after you can see your pcap file indexed in Splunk it is removed from your source folder. The new location of the PCAP File is: $SPLUNK_HOME\etc\apps\SplunkForPCAP\PCAPConverted. That is happening to avoid that the automatic script converts your pcap file twice.

Analysis The App includes Dashboards which will show you:
- The Top Talker IP's, Protocols, Ports, VLANs, Conversations
- Detailed overview about IP Conversations, Packet Loss, TCP Error's, Round Trip Time
- Conversation Sankey Diagram (by Packets, by Bytes, by Destination Port)
- Microburst Dashboard (Bit timechart)
- DNS / NFS / HTTP / Keep Alive Communication Dashboards
- Hop Calculator between two IP's

Thanks for downloading PCAP Analyzer for Splunk! I hope the application can help you to analyze your problem in a better way and maybe even give you the right hint to the solution!
